sen.j: 大野木 秀次郎（おおのぎ ひでじろう、1895年11月25日 - 1966年3月4日）は、政治家。
sen.e: Hidejiro ONOGI (Nov 25, 1895 – March 3, 1966) was a politician.
Hidejiro ONOGI (Nov 25, 1895 – March 3, 1966) was a politician.
Hidejiro ONOGI (Nov 25, 1895 – March 3, 1966) was a politician.

sen.j: 京都府京都市東山区山科（現・山科区）生まれ。
sen.e: Born at Yamashina (present day Yamashina-ku (Ward)), Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Born in Yamashina (present day Yamashina-ku (Ward)), Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Born in Yamashina (present day Yamashina Ward), Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 立命館大学経済科中退。
sen.e: Dropped out of Ritsumeikan University (Department of Economics).
Dropped out of Ritsumeikan University (Department of Economics).
Dropped out of Ritsumeikan University (Department of Economics).

sen.j: 1946年、貴族院 (日本)議員(多額納税者議員)に当選。
sen.e: In 1946 was elected to be a Councilor of Japan's House of Lords (large taxpayer Councilor).
In 1946 was elected a Councilor of Japan's House of Lords (large taxpayer Councilor).
In 1946 was elected a Councilor of Japan's House of Lords (large taxpayer Councilor).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角に訂正しました。

sen.j: 翌1947年には第1回参議院議員通常選挙に自由党より出馬し当選。
sen.e: In the following year (1947) was elected in the first regular Upper House election running as a Liberal Party candidate.
In the following year (1947), running as a Liberal Party candidate, he was elected in the first regular Upper House election.
In the following year (1947), running as a Liberal Party candidate, he was elected in the first regular Upper House election.
He served for 4 terms.
He served 4 terms.
He served 4 terms.

sen.j: 在任中は、サンフランシスコ講和条約の首席全権代理、参議院自由党議員会長、自民党京都府議連初代会長（4期連続）などを務めた他、第三次から第五次吉田内閣で国務大臣を務めるなど国政の要職を歴任した。
sen.e: Whilst sitting as a Councilor, he served as a Deputy Minister Plenipotentiary at the time of the San Francisco Treaty of Peace, Chairperson of the Liberal Party Councilors in the Upper House and the first Chairperson of the Liberal Party Kyoto Member Union (4 consecutive terms) etc. Besides this he attended to important matters of state as Minister of State etc as a member of the 3rd through to 5th Yoshida Cabinets.

Whilst sitting as a Councilor, he served as a Deputy Minister Plenipotentiary at the time of the San Francisco Peace Treaty, as Chairperson of the Liberal Party Councilors in the Upper House, and the first Chairperson of the Liberal Party Kyoto Member Union (4 consecutive terms), and in other posts; in addition, he attended to important matters of state as Minister of State and other posts in the 3rd through to 5th Yoshida Cabinets.

Whilst sitting as a Councilor, he served as a Deputy Minister Plenipotentiary at the time of the San Francisco Peace Treaty, as Chairperson of the Liberal Party Councilors in the Upper House, and the first Chairperson of the Liberal Party Kyoto Member Union (4 consecutive terms), and in other posts; in addition, he attended to important matters of state as Minister of State and other posts in the 3rd through to 5th Yoshida Cabinets.

sen.j: 実業界では京都商工クラブ会長に就任した他、寺社関係において鞍馬寺、知恩院、泉涌寺、妙心寺の総代として活躍。
sen.e: Besides serving the business world in roles such as Chairperson of the Kyoto Commerce and Industry Club, he played an active role in religious matters as a representative of Kurama-dera Temple, Chionin Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple and Myoshin-ji Temple.

Besides serving the business world in roles such as Chairperson of the Kyoto Commerce and Industry Club, he played an active role in religious matters as a representative of Kurama-dera Temple, Chionin Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple, and Myoshin-ji Temple.

Besides serving the business world in roles such as Chairperson of the Kyoto Commerce and Industry Club, he played an active role in religious matters as a representative of Kurama-dera Temple, Chion-in Temple, Sennyu-ji Temple, and Myoshin-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。

sen.j: また、母校の立命館大学や、京都薬科大学で理事職にあったほか、京都外国語大学では理事長を勤めるなど教育界においても幅広い活躍をみせた。
sen.e: He also played an active role in a wide range of education circles by serving as a board member of Kyoto Pharmaceutical University and his alma mater, Ritsumeikan University, and elsewhere, and by sitting as President of Kyoto University of Foreign Studies.

He also played an active role in a wide range of education circles by serving as a board member of Kyoto Pharmaceutical University and his alma mater, Ritsumeikan University, and elsewhere, and by sitting as President of Kyoto University of Foreign Studies.

He also played an active role in a wide range of education circles by serving as a board member of Kyoto Pharmaceutical University and his alma mater, Ritsumeikan University, and elsewhere, and by sitting as President of Kyoto University of Foreign Studies.

sen.j: なお、大野木が昭和11年に京都市山科区に建てた自宅は、現在「京都洛東迎賓館」となっている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the home that Onogi built in 1936 in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto Prefecture is currently used as the "Kyoto Rakutogeihinkan"(Kyoto Rakuto Guest House).
Furthermore, the home that Onogi built in 1936 in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto Prefecture is currently used as the "Kyoto Rakutogeihinkan"(Kyoto Rakuto Guest House).
Furthermore, the home that Onogi built in 1936 in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto Prefecture is currently used as the 'Kyoto Rakutogeihinkan' (Kyoto Rakuto Guest House).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。
